Text.jp: Insufficient funds to complete this transaction.
Text.sc: 没有足够的资金来完成这笔交易。

Text.jp: Remove traffic lights from this crossroad
Text.sc: 从这个十字路口移除红绿灯

Text.jp: Set up traffic lights with preset #1
Set up traffic lights with preset #2
Set up traffic lights for this crossroad
Text.sc: 为这个十字路口设置红绿灯

Text.jp: Do you want to sell this vehicle?
Do you want to sack this person?
Do you want to delete this route?
Do you want to sell this vehicle?
Do you want to sack this employee?
Do you want to sell this vehicle?
Do you want to sack this employee?
Do you want to delete this route?
Do you want to sell this vehicle?
Do you want to sack this person?
Do you want to delete this route?

The roads are heavily damaged in some locations. Traffic is slow on these roads. If you click on the "Road damage" button you can highlight these locations. It will show the usability of the roads as a percentage. The higher this value is the better the road is.
Text.sc: 在一些地方道路严重受损。在这些道路上的交通很缓慢。如果你点击"道路受损"按钮你可以高亮这些位置。它会以百分比的形式显示道路的可用性。这个值越高路就越好。

Text.jp: The roads are covered in dirt and dust. Traffic is slow on these roads. Buy road cleaning vehicles and assign them routes to clean the affected roads.
Text.sc: 道路满是污垢和灰尘。在这些道路上的交通很缓慢。购买道路清洁车并将其分配去清理受影响的道路。

Text.jp: Some roads are covered in snow. Traffic is slow in these areas. Buy snowploughs (road cleaners) and assign them routes to clean the affected roads.
Text.sc: 一些道路被白雪覆盖。在这些地区交通很缓慢。购买扫雪车(道路清洁工)并将其分配去清理受影响的道路。

Text.jp: There was a big storm which affected some traffic lights. The lights are just blinking yellow. Send repair staff to fix the lamps and get the lights back into operation.
Text.sc: 有一场大风暴影响了一些红绿灯。这些灯直闪黄灯。派维修工去修理这些等并将其重新投入使用。

Text.jp: More and more people are using cars instead of public transportation. Transit traffic is light. Due to the harsh winter weather the roads are more likely to get damaged in spring.
Text.sc: 越来越多的人使用私家车而不是公共交通。过境交通负载不大。由于严酷的天气状况，道路在春季更容易受损。

Text.jp: School is over, people are on vacation, therefore inner city traffic decreases. However transit traffic will increase as people go on holidays. The dust and smog level will also increase due to the increasing temperature.
Text.sc: 学校放假，人们都在休假，因此市中心交通通畅。然而当人们去度假时，过境交通会上升。由于气温上升，灰尘和烟雾等级也会随之增加。

Text.jp: Schools starts again, everyone gets back from vacation. Inner city traffic will increase and transit traffic will decrease. Dust levels will increase due to the fallen leaves.
Text.sc: 学校重新开学，每个人都休完了假。市中心交通压力会增加而过境交通就会下降。尘埃水平会因为落叶而增加。

Text.jp: More and more people are using public transportation. Snow can slow down traffic. Transit traffic is light. Due to snowstorms traffic lights can get damaged.
Text.sc: 越来越多的人使用公共交通。雪可以使交通变得缓慢。过境交通人不多。由于暴风雪红绿灯容易损坏。

Text.jp: transit vehicles should leave the city on the designated roads as quickly as possible
Text.sc: 过境车辆应尽可能快地按指定道路离开这个城市

Text.jp: cars should reach their destination in the city as quickly as possible
Text.sc: 车辆应该在城市中尽快到达它们的目的地

Text.jp: pedestrians should reach their destination using buses or trams as quickly as possible
Text.sc: 行人应尽快使用巴士或电车到达目的地

Text.jp: you will get bonus points if a transit vehicle reaches its transit exit point
Text.sc: 如果一辆过境车辆到达运输出口点，你就会得到奖励分

Text.jp: you will get penalty points if a transit vehicle leaves the city at any other point
Text.sc: 如果一辆过境车辆在任何其他的点离开城市，你会得到处罚分

Text.jp: 1 bonus point for reaching a transit exit
Text.sc: 到达运输出口获得1奖励积分

Text.jp: 2 bonus points for reaching a transit exit quickly
Text.sc: 快速到达一个运输出口得2奖励分

Text.jp: 3 bonus points for reaching a transit exit very quickly
Text.sc: 急速到达一个运输出口得3奖励分
车辆上的过境交通标志

Text.jp: you will get bonus points if a car reaches its destination
Text.sc: 如果一辆车到达目的地，你会得到奖励分

Text.jp: you will get penalty points if a car gets into a traffic jam
Text.sc: 如果一辆车进入交通堵塞，你会得到处罚分

Text.jp: 1 bonus point if a car reaches its destination
Text.sc: 如果一辆车到达目的地，得1奖励分

Text.jp: 2 bonus points if a car reaches its destination quickly
Text.sc: 如果一辆车较快地到达目的地，得2奖励分

Text.jp: 3 bonus points if a car reaches its destination very quickly
Text.sc: 如果一辆车非常快地到达目的地，得3奖励分

Text.jp: Cars will always find their destination on the other side of the city
Text.sc: 车子总会在城市的另一边找到其目的地

Text.jp: Traffic density depends on the time of the day:
Text.sc: 交通密度取决于一天的时间:

Text.jp: - early morning: little transit traffic, no local traffic
Text.sc: - 清晨:很少过境交通，没有本地交通

Text.jp: - morning: transit traffic increases, very dense local traffic
Text.sc: - 早晨:过境交通增加，密集的本地交通

Text.jp: - noon: transit traffic increases, local traffic decreases
Text.sc: - 中午:过境交通增加， 本地交通减少

Text.jp: - afternoon: heavy transit traffic, very heavy local traffic
Text.sc: - 下午:繁重的过境交通，非常繁重的本地交通

Text.jp: - late afternoon: transit traffic decreases, a few local traffic
Text.sc: - 午后:过境交通减少，少量本地交通

Text.jp: If a pedestrian reaches their destination via public transport you will get bonus points
Text.sc: 如果一个行人通过公共交通工具到达目的地，你会得到奖励分

Text.jp: Pedestrians not reaching their destination via public transport will cause penalty points
Text.sc: 如果一个行人没有通过公共交通工具到达目的地，你会得到处罚分

Text.jp: 1 bonus point if a pedestrian reaches their destination via public transport
Text.sc: 如果一个行人通过公共交通工具到达目的地，你会得到1奖励分

Text.jp: 2 bonus points if a pedestrian reaches their destination via public transport quickly
Text.sc: 如果一个行人通过公共交通工具较快到达目的地，你会得到2奖励分

Text.jp: 3 bonus points if a pedestrian reaches their destination via public transport very quickly
Text.sc: 如果一个行人通过公共交通工具很快到达目的地，你会得到3奖励分

Text.jp: - pedestrians will always find their destination on the other side of the city
Text.sc: - 行人总能在城市的另一边找到他们的目的地

Text.jp: - pedestrian count depends on the time of the day.
Text.sc: - 行人的数量取决于一天的时间。

Text.jp: - pedestrians will only use public transport if it takes them near their destination.
Text.sc: - 如果公共交通能带他们到目的地附近，他们会选择公共交通。

Text.jp: - pedestrians will only stand at a bus or tram stop if there is a bus line for them to use.
Text.sc: - 如果有一条巴士线可用的话，行人会站在巴士站或者电车站中。

Text.jp: - if they can't find a suitable bus stop they will use their cars. This leads to a penalty point.
Text.sc: - 如果他们找不到可用的巴士站，他们就会开私家车。这会让你得到一个处罚分。

Text.jp: - if they have to wait too long at a bus stop they will use their cars. This leads to a penalty point.
Text.sc: - 如果他们在巴士站很久都等不到车，他们就会开私家车。这回让你的得到一个处罚分。

Text.jp: if the smog level is low you will get bonus points
Text.sc: 如果烟雾水平很低，你会得到奖励分

Text.jp: if the smog level is high you will get penalty points
Text.sc: 如果烟雾水平很高，你会得到处罚分
- 烟雾值每小时评估一次

Text.jp: - smog level depends on the following:
You can find the tutorial video button on the right side menu.
Text.sc: 你可以在右侧菜单找到教程视频按钮。

Text.jp: Please watch these videos to learn about the game.
Text.sc: 请观看这些视频来了解游戏。

Text.jp: - you will see that seasons have an affect on traffic
Text.sc: - 你会看到季节对于交通的影响

Text.jp: - snow and storms will challenge your abilities
Text.sc: - 雪和风暴将挑战你的能力

Text.jp: - the city will get more and more crowded, you will have to enlarge and repair roads
Text.sc: - 这个城市会变得越来越拥挤，你将不得不拓展并修复道路

Text.jp: If you succeed, you will get more and more parts of the city under your control.
Text.sc: 如果你成功了，你就会得到这座城市越来越多的地区控制权。
- 这款游戏有4个基本目标

Text.jp: - if you succeed in these basic goals, you will get bonus points
Text.sc: - 如果你成功达到这几个基本目标，你会得到奖励分

Text.jp: - these bonus points will be converted to money at the end of the day
Text.sc: - 这些奖励分会在一天结束时转换成钱

Text.jp: Hint: hire more bus drivers, as they can get tired. A tired driver can cause an accident.
Text.sc: 提示:雇佣更多的巴士司机，因为他们会感到疲惫。一个疲惫的司机可以造成事故。

Text.jp: Hint: hire more tram drivers, as they can get tired. A tired driver can cause an accident.
Text.sc: 提示:雇佣更多的电车司机，因为他们会感到疲惫。一个疲惫的司机可以造成事故。

Text.jp: Hint: hire more workers, as they can get tired. A tired worker works slower.
Text.sc: 提示:雇佣更多的工人，因为他们会感到疲惫。一个疲惫的工人工作速度很慢。

Text.jp: Hint: hire more workers, as they can get tired. A tired worker works slower.
Text.sc: 提示:雇佣更多的工人，因为他们会感到疲惫。一个疲惫的工人工作速度很慢。

Text.jp: The driver was tired and has caused an accident. The passengers are angry. Regularly check the fitness of your drivers. Employ more drivers so that they can cover each other. When a bus heads out, the fittest of all available drivers will be automatically selected.
Text.sc: 司机累了并已经造成了交通事故。乘客很生气。定期检查你的司机的健康状况。雇佣更多的司机，这样他们可以交班。当一辆巴士要出发时，会自动选择最佳的可用司机。

Text.jp: The vehicle has broken down due to its poor condition. Regularly check the condition of vehicles. Send them for maintenance once in a while.
Text.sc: 车辆损坏因其糟糕的情况。定期检查车辆的状况。给它们偶尔的维护。

Text.jp: The vehicle has broken down due to its poor condition. The passengers are angry. Check the condition of the vehicles regularly. Send them for maintenance once in a while.
Text.sc: 车辆损坏因其糟糕的情况。乘客很生气。定期检查车辆的状况。给它们偶尔的维护。

Text.jp: Smog level (hourly statistics: viewed / total count)
Text.sc: 烟雾水平(每小时统计:观察/总计数)

Text.jp: Traffic jams (hourly statistics: viewed / total count)
Text.sc: 塞车(每小时统计:观察/总计数)
道路清洁工路线(观察/总计数)

Text.jp: Congratulations on your successful job. Now you have control over another part of the city. Keep on watching the needs of commuters as their destinations changed. Be prepared, because this time the number of transit routes going through the city has been doubled. Good luck.
Text.sc: 祝贺你完成了漂亮的工作。现在你可以控制城市的另一部分。在乘客目的地发生改变时，继续关注他们的需求。做好准备，因为这次穿过这座城市的交通压力将会成倍增长。祝你好运。

Text.jp: If you change between full screen and windowed modes you will have to restart the game. Please save your game before exiting.
Text.sc: 如果要在全屏和窗口模式之间切换，你必须要重新启动游戏。在退出之前，请保存你的游戏。

Text.jp: To take effect you have to restart the game. Unsaved game progress will be lost. Quit now?
Text.sc: 欲使其生效就必须重新启动游戏。未保存的游戏进度将会丢失。现在退出？

Text.jp: Congratulations! You have done your job well! From now on you can play freely without any time limits. The city will remain the same size as now but the traffic and the number of pedestrians will increase daily. Good luck!
Text.sc: 恭喜！你干得很漂亮！从现在起，你可以自由发挥，没有任何时间限制。城市规模将保持相同的大小，但现在每天的交通和行人的数量将增加。祝你好运！

Text.jp: Bonus points for cars reaching their destination. You can get 1 to 3 points depending on the journey time.
Text.sc: 汽车到达其目的地就会得到奖励分。你可以得到1至3个分数，这依照行车时间而定。

Text.jp: Bonus points for transit cars leaving the city at the designated exit points. You can get 1 to 3 points depending on the journey time.
Text.sc: 汽车按照指定的出口点离开城市就会得到奖励分。你可以得到1至3个分数，这依照行车时间而定。

Text.jp: Bonus points for pedestrians using public transportation. You can get 1 to 3 points depending on the journey time. First line is the number of people getting off the transport above that the bonus points gained.
Text.sc: 行人使用公共交通就会得到奖励分。你可以得到1至3个分数，这依照行车时间而定。第一行是人下车数以上获得奖励分。

Text.jp: Number of people getting on the bus.
Penalty point for getting into a traffic jam.
Text.sc: 进入堵车会得到处罚分。

Text.jp: Penalty point for transit vehicle leaving the city not at a designated exit point.
Text.sc: 过境车辆不在指定的出口点离开这个城市会得到处罚分。

Text.jp: Penalty point for a pedestrian waiting too long for public transport to come and deciding to use a car, therefore increasing the traffic in the city.
Text.sc: 行人因等巴士太久而决定开私家车，因此增加了城市交通压力，这会得到处罚分。

Text.jp: Payment due to fuel usage. The better the reliability factor of the vehicle is the less fuel it consumes.
Text.sc: 燃料使用的费用。车子的可靠性越高，消耗的燃料越少。

Text.jp: A vehicle broke down either because of lack of maintenance or due to an accident. You have to send this vehicle for maintenance otherwise it may cause a traffic jam.
Text.sc: 因缺乏维修或因意外事故导致车辆抛锚。你将此车送去维修，否则可能会引起交通堵塞。
乘客 - 始发和目的地区域

Text.jp: Yellow light start time - traffic lights deactivated
Text.sc: 黄灯开始时间 - 红绿灯失效

Text.jp: Yellow light end time - traffic lights activated
Text.sc: 黄灯结束时间 - 红绿灯失效

Text.jp: You have unsaved progress! Do you want to quit?
Less car and pedestrian traffic. Roads gets damaged and covered by dirt or snow slower.
Text.sc: 少量汽车和行人的交通状况。道路损坏并被污垢或雪覆盖的速度较慢。

Text.jp: Normal car and pedestrian traffic. Roads gets damaged and covered by dirt or snow at normal speed.
Text.sc: 普通汽车和行人的交通状况。道路损坏并被污垢或雪覆盖的速度一般。

Text.jp: Dense car and pedestrian traffic. Roads gets damaged and covered by dirt or snow quicker.
Text.sc: 密集汽车和行人的交通状况。道路损坏并被污垢或雪覆盖的速度较快。

Text.jp: Road construction is complete. Please link the road to the existing road network.
Text.sc: 道路建设完成。请链接道路到现有的道路网络。

Text.jp: Traffic light construction is complete. Please set the lights to your requirements.
Text.sc: 红绿灯建设已经完成。请按你的要求设置灯。

Text.jp: Set up 3 road cleaning routes with 3 road cleaners or snowploughs.
Text.sc: 用3个道路清洁工或扫雪车建立3条道路清扫路线。

Text.jp: Set up 5 bus routes with 10 buses and 20 drivers.
Text.sc: 用10辆巴士和20名司机设置5条巴士路线。
使用公共交通工具运送500名乘客。

Text.jp: Route 5,000 transit vehicles through the city.
Text.sc: 按某路线发送5,000辆过境车辆穿城。

Text.jp: Build 5 road sections of any type.
Text.sc: 建造5个任何类型的路段。

Text.jp: Build 15 road sections of any type.
Text.sc: 建造15个任何类型的路段。

Text.jp: Build 120 road sections of any type.
Text.sc: 建造120个任何类型的路段。

Text.jp: Congratulations! You have completed an achievement!
Text.sc: 恭喜！你已经完成了一项成就！

Text.jp: You can earn money and unlock vehicles by completing achievements.
Text.sc: 你可以通过完成成就来赚钱并解锁车辆。

Text.jp: Thank you for purchasing Traffic Manager!
Road repair is complete. You can assign your groundworks team to another area.
Text.sc: 道路维修完成。你可以指定你的基础团队到另一个区域。

Text.jp: You will loose passengers currently on the bus. Do you really want to repair this vehicle?
Text.sc: 你将会放下在巴士里面的乘客。确定修理此车？

Text.jp: You will loose passengers currently on the tram. Do you really want to repair this vehicle?
Text.sc: 你将会放下在电车里面的乘客。确定修理此车？

Text.jp: Pedestrians always travel to the opposite side of the city. Their destination can be viewed with the help of the pedestrian info button located on the right hand side. By clicking on pedestrians you can check their destination and the size of the area they are heading to. Pedestrians only go to a bus station if they can reach their destination by bus or tram. It is advisable to have more bus drivers than buses, this means drivers can take turns driving and while resting, their condition improves.
Text.sc: 行人总是到城市的另一边。他们的目的地可以通过右侧的行人信息按钮被观察到。通过单击行人可以检查他们的目的地和他们前往区域的大小。如果他们可以乘巴士或有轨电车到达目的地，行人只会去车站。雇佣更多的巴士司机而不是买更多的巴士是明智的，这意味着司机可以轮流开车并轮休，他们的状况会得以提升。

Text.jp: Pedestrians always travel to the opposite side of the city. Their destination can be viewed with the help of the pedestrian info button located on the right hand side. By clicking on pedestrians you can check their destination and the size of the area they are heading to. Pedestrians only go to a bus station if they can reach their destination by bus or tram. It is advisable to have more tram drivers than trams, this means drivers can take turns driving and while resting, their condition improves.
Text.sc: 行人总是到城市的另一边。他们的目的地可以通过右侧的行人信息按钮被观察到。通过单击行人可以检查他们的目的地和他们前往区域的大小。如果他们可以乘巴士或有轨电车到达目的地，行人只会去车站。雇佣更多的巴士司机而不是买更多的电车是明智的，这意味着司机可以轮流开车并轮休，他们的状况会得以提升。

Text.jp: Your tasks include road maintenance and reducing the smog level in the city. The dust and dirt on the roads greatly increase the smog level. In winter, snow can significantly slow traffic. You have to set up the routes of the snow-ploughs. This is done exactly the same as setting bus routes. During the rest of the year street-cleaning vehicles should be sent out. The statistics menu gives a daily overview of the hourly changes in smog and dust levels.
Text.sc: 你的任务是在城市中道路维护和减少烟雾水平。在道路上的尘埃和污垢大大增加烟雾水平。在冬天，雪可以显著减慢交通。你必须设置清雪路线。这和设置巴士线一样。在今年下半年，街道清扫车应该可投入使用。统计菜单会给出烟雾和灰尘水平每小时变化的每日概述。

Text.jp: In certain places it is possible to widen the road. To do this, you have to purchase the required construction machinery. New machines are capable of building roads twice as fast. You can choose from three road types. Selecting a higher quality road surface means increased construction costs but the rate of wear will be significantly less. Construction of new roads takes time. The remaining time is displayed by the clock symbol appearing over the road. If a road crossing equipped with traffic lights is affected by the construction then the lights should be re-adjusted, because a new set of traffic lights has been introduced into the system.
Text.sc: 在某些地方可以加宽道路。为此，你必须购买所需的施工机械。新机器可以修建公路事半功倍。 你可以选择三种道路类型。选择高质量的路面也意味着增加了建设成本，但磨损率将会大大减少。建设新道路需要时间。剩余时间会以道路上方的时间标志方式显示。如果一个装备红绿灯的十字路口被建设所影响，红绿灯就会重新调整，因为一组新的红绿灯已经被加入此系统。

Text.jp: Road condition will deteriorate over time and potholes will need to be fixed. Road condition is given as a percentage. 100% represents roads in perfect condition, while 10% refers to the worst possible road condition, which severely limits the speed of vehicles. The costs of road repairs depend on the condition of the road; lower condition means higher prices.
Text.sc: 道路状况会随着时间的推移而恶化，而坑洞则需要被修补。道路状况会以百分比显示。100%代表道路完好无损，当10%可能指的是最糟糕的道路条件，这严重限制了车辆的速度。道路维修的成本取决于道路的状况;较差的路况意味着更高的价格。

Text.jp: Effective traffic control requires the installation of traffic lights. After the traffic light system has been properly installed at an intersection it needs to be adjusted. The game offers two default settings (1 - vehicles are allowed to proceed in only one direction at any time; 2 - vehicles in the two opposite lanes can proceed at the same time), but these can be freely modified. The inactive period (when only the yellow signal is illuminated) also has to be set. This should be the preferred option at night when traffic is low. In summer, storms can damage traffic lights and they will no longer function properly. In such cases you have to despatch repair teams to fix them.
Text.sc: 有效的交通控制需要安装交通信号灯。在交通灯系统安装在一个十字路口后，它也需要调整。游戏提供了两种默认设置(1 - 车辆被允许继续在任何时候都只有一个方向可行; 2 - 车辆在两个相反的通道可以同时进行)，但这些可以被自由地修改。闲置期间(当只有黄灯闪烁时)也必须设置。 这在晚上交通不拥堵的时候是首选。在夏天，风暴会破坏交通信号灯，它们将不再正常运转。在这种情况下你必须派维修团队修复它们。

Text.jp: In order to have a well-designed traffic system, you must carefully set the flow of traffic. You also have to ensure that drivers can reach the parking lots.
Text.sc: 为了有一个设计良好的交通系统，你必须精心设置车流。你也必须确保司机可以到达停车场。

Text.jp: You have to ensure that the transit traffic can quickly and easily get through the city. The direction of the transit traffic can be set at each intersection. With the help of the transit info button, located on the right hand side, you can identify the transiting vehicles, as well as the locations where they enter and exit the city. This is also displayed on the transit map in the statistics menu.
Text.sc: 你必须确保过境交通可以迅速并轻易地穿城。过境交通指示可设置在每个十字路口。借助交通信息按钮，位于右侧，你可以确定过境车辆，以及它们进入和离开这个城市的地点。这同样显示在统计菜单的交通地图上。

Text.jp: It is important to have primary roads. Of course, if you have traffic light systems installed at the intersections, this is not essential. But when the traffic lights are inactive (i.e. only the yellow signal is illuminated), priority signs control the flow of the vehicles.
Text.sc: 建设干道很重要。当然，如果你在十字路口装有红绿灯系统，这就不需要了。但当交通灯失效时(即只有黄色灯在闪烁)，优先级标志控制车流。

Text.jp: It is possible to reverse the direction of certain one-way roads. Keep in mind that in such cases the operation of all affected traffic lights needs to be adjusted.
Text.sc: 这有可能会颠倒某一单行线的方向。记住，在这种情况下所有受影响的红绿灯都需要调整。

Text.jp: Your budget is negative. You have to manage your finances better. Your next income will be at the end of the day if your bonuses are positive.
Text.sc: 你的预算是负的。你需要更好地管理你的财务状况。如果你的奖金是正数的话，你的下一次收入将会在今天结束时获得。

Text.jp: Travellers transported this day by bus and tram
Text.sc: 旅客今天乘巴士和电车

Text.jp: Travellers not transported by public transportation and used cars instead
Text.sc: 旅客不乘坐巴士并开私家车

Text.jp: Do you really want to repair this vehicle?
